definition: Shen Kuo (1031-1095), Chinese polymath, scientist and statesman of Song dynasty, author of Dream Pool Essays 夢溪筆談|梦溪笔谈[Meng4 Xi1 Bi3 tan2]
liquid/to pour
surname Shen/place name
variant of 沉[chen2]
to enclose/to include/also pr. [gua1]

sentences.english: Chen Gua ambitions to buy a house and bashfully lets the left Yi companion him to watch creating together.
sentences.chinese: 沈括要买房，扭扭捏捏的让左伊陪他一起去看房。

sentences.english: Shen Kuo was an outstanding patriot in the North Song dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 沈括是北宋一位出色的爱国者。

sentences.english: Shen Kuo, a famous scientist of Song Dynasty of ancient China, detected a change of rate of the water clock.
sentences.chinese: 宋代著名的科学家沈括发现了一种漏壶的迟疾现象。

sentences.english: The part ends with a conclusion of the noumenon characteristics of Shen Kuo's concept of temperament-number.
sentences.chinese: 上篇最后归纳了沈括律数的概念数本体特征。

definition: Dream Pool Essays by Shen Kuo 沈括[Shen3 Kuo4], book on various fields of knowledge, the first to describe the magnetic needle compass
Wang Anshi (1021-1086), Song dynasty politician and writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家
Su Yijian (958-997), Northern Song writer and poet
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
Fan Zhongyan (989-1052), minister of Northern Song who led the failed reform of 1043, author of On Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓記|岳阳楼记
Cai Xiang (1012-1067), Song calligrapher
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]

History of the Song Dynasty, twentieth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed under Toktoghan 脫脫|脱脱[Tuo1 tuo1] in 1345 during the Yuan Dynasty 元[Yuan2], 496 scrolls/(not to be confused with 宋書|宋书[Song4 shu1])

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Su Xun (1009-1066), Northern Song writer of prose, one of the Three Su 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of Eight Giants 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
Song Qi (998-1061), Song dynasty poet and writer, coauthor of History of the Later Tang Dynasty 新唐書|新唐书
Song Dynasty (960-1279)/also Song of Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479)
Xu Xuan (-991), author of commentaries on Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字註|说文解字注[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4 Zhu4]
Su Dongpo, another name for Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼 (1037-1101), northern Song writer and calligrapher
Song Lian (1310-1381), Ming dynasty writer, historian and politician
